channel.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
channel.description:
[center][size=12pt][b]Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?[/b][/size][/center]
Here is the program which was found by [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=2730]Pups[/url]. Sorry I didn't make this a sticky sooner, people were asking me on MSN and PMing me, so here it is.
Just download this, load the scar file, and hit format! :D http://www.dow.wau.nl/aew/downloads/DelFor.zip
~Ron
Kane and Mopar also discovered this. Here's Kane's topic. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,31022.0.html

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Treeing your code is smart, but doing it by hand takes a while
That's why you do it from the start, SCAR keeps track of the current indentation, and turning smart tabs off makes it easy so what's the problem?

although I do think it would be sexy if the SCAR IDE has automatic indentation like JBuilder or IntelliJ hint

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

lol.

well my opinion is this: use your own standards for personal scripts. If you want to release them, make sure they are in standards everyone can read. If you dont want to fine. Make people use this program. There.

I prefer using standards as i go along though

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“N4TH4N, post:17, topic:28669”]Bebemycat2, say you go to help someone with their code but WAIT they don’t have it tree’d. I don’t know about you but this is very, very annoying to me and lowers my want to help them.
Case open and shut.[/quote]
I don’t help noobs “code”.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I always tree my code. I was saying just for the people who don’t. And there are many that do not.

Edit: It is retarded, but people are just lazy.

[quote=“yakman, post:15, topic:28669”]Shes right,
dont format your code at all

whos cares what other people think? its only keeping SCAR alive!

no seriously, i used to not make my code readable at all, i was just about the only person who ever read it.

if people are updating your scripts, its better if you use standards[/quote]

Exactly that’s why all scar scripts are open source.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Why would you not format as you code?

That’s retarded to write code then go back and format it later.

Shes right,
dont format your code at all

whos cares what other people think? its only keeping SCAR alive!

no seriously, i used to not make my code readable at all, i was just about the only person who ever read it.

if people are updating your scripts, its better if you use standards

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:9, topic:28669”][quote author=N4TH4N link=topic=42302.msg544528#msg544528 date=1164798113]

Surely, the standards are there mostly to make code neater and therefore minimise mistakes while coding? What’s the point in writing a script without using the standards, and then formatting it with this later on?

Debugging, readability, not looking like an incompetent fool.
[/quote]

Exactly! Scar is all open source coding (for the most part), so with coding standards it’s easy to learn from other scripts and improve and debug them!

Treeing your code is smart, but doing it by hand takes a while, so this is just easier. For example, my crazy stats grabber was like 2200 lines of form code. There is no way I’m gonna sit there for 6 hours tabbing 2 spaces behind all the form code. So I just used this.

~Ron[/quote]

Why would you not format as you code?

That’s retarded to write code then go back and format it later.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Ron:

Ehh oh well. There, if it means anything, I added your link, so people can click on the download link OR just for fun, click on the topic link, and click on the download link. lol.

You don’t have to. What’s the point, lol? Yours is better found. Just use it.

DelFor ftw <3

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a SCAR formatter/indenter?
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:9, topic:28669”][quote author=N4TH4N link=topic=42302.msg544528#msg544528 date=1164798113]

Surely, the standards are there mostly to make code neater and therefore minimise mistakes while coding? What’s the point in writing a script without using the standards, and then formatting it with this later on?

Debugging, readability, not looking like an incompetent fool.
[/quote]

Exactly! Scar is all open source coding (for the most part), so with coding standards it’s easy to learn from other scripts and improve and debug them!

Treeing your code is smart, but doing it by hand takes a while, so this is just easier. For example, my crazy stats grabber was like 2200 lines of form code. There is no way I’m gonna sit there for 6 hours tabbing 2 spaces behind all the form code. So I just used this.

~Ron[/quote]

  1. Highlight block of code
  2. Press Tab
  3. Press Shift+Tab

Read full topic

Surely, the standards are there mostly to make code neater and therefore minimise mistakes while coding? What’s the point in writing a script without using the standards, and then formatting it with this later on?
[/quote]

Debugging, readability, not looking like an incompetent fool.[/quote]

Exactly! Scar is all open source coding (for the most part), so with coding standards it’s easy to learn from other scripts and improve and debug them!

Treeing your code is smart, but doing it by hand takes a while, so this is just easier. For example, my crazy stats grabber was like 2200 lines of form code. There is no way I’m gonna sit there for 6 hours tabbing 2 spaces behind all the form code. So I just used this.

~Ron
